column5: Been working on rebuilding my laker trolling stick over the holidays. It was beginning to show it's age and needed a refresh.    Stripped it down to the bare blank and built me a sexy looking handle. Just finished installing it last night.    Still have to install guides and do a cool looking butt wrap but have tons of time before the ice goes out.
Ok, you locked yourself in a dark room, listening to Black Sabbath, with a strob light, drinking straight dark rum?   That is different bud.
I like walnut and blued steel on my firearms and good cork and simple windings on my fishing rods    but whatever turns your crank , the craftsmanship and quality looks great , not Bubba'ed
Nice job man-trippy looking handle bud--forget the riff raff here-they're just jealous  dark rum dark room-funny sheet BB Happy New Year  All

I've been hanging out with a bunch of miscreants that are into doing crazy stuff with EVA foam and thread lately. Getting ready to start building retirement saltwater fishing sticks and need to practice.  http://www.northeastrodbuilders.com/  https://www.facebook.com/groups/198581950187042/
Hanging out with the NERBs, eh?  A bit flashier than I personally like, but it looks like some good tight work. Now you've got to come up with some wraps to match.

Nice job Dave. I like my stuff a bit less flashy. I even might beat up my stuff so no one would ever think about putting the gleep on it. The big dent on my tailgate I did when I Christened the new Silverado at 2500 KMS is still there 5 years latter. They steal them out here in Haldimand for the tailgates amongst other parts, not mine, or my beat up looking rods.
Bit more of a classic look on a rebuild I'm working on
